__e: I hope I don't make a damn fool of myself.
What are you trying to do, Make a sap out of me?
This is funny, me telling you not to let anyone make a fool of you.
Doesn't he know, young fool, when it's time to go home?
"You can cut out that "Darby and" "Jones" stuff."
I don't really think he knows how silly that sounds.
But I'm not a Looney, and I'm not interested in any opinion you may form on that subject.
Don't you realise that her sister told me the truth, how you were a young fool, and I was an old one, which is worse.
You'll probably find it very dull and commonplace but I want to earn enough to help my father buy a boat.
You are one lousy bastard! A coward!
Now listen, you fool, there's nothing wrong with you.
Oh, and you, too, my stupid friend. I wouldn't forget you.
There is nobody in the street a night like this.
Why do you think I'd be foolish enough... to hand that child over to you?
How did I know you'd be silly enough to try a thing like this?
I'd be a fool to give them away for free, wouldn't I?
Your brother is a fool if you don't mind my saying so.
He's a sucker to consider going through with the marriage.
